channel.title: Task: How to do it?
channel.description:
Hey,
at my research i am biasing voltage and incrementally changing it by factor of 2, now here is the problem, since i am using Electrostatic Force Microscopy (EFM), each image takes about 30mins to render, i just don't want to be sitting there waiting for it, since the lab is in the basement and i don't want to be there the whole day, i do about 12 pictures, so thats about 6h. I want to automate it, so this is what i am trying to do is after each scan, i want the automation to go and change the value, and click on capture, now the thing i am not so sure how to do is that how will i make it detect if the picture has been taken, since if a picture (composed of 3 vectors) taken a new file will be created in C:/capture. anyone know a way, it'd be good in java, python or C++, i guess java would be good since i want to make a GUI, so other's in the group can easily use it on different machines.

item.title: Task: How to do it?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you need it to type and click on a GUI, then the easiest, quickest way to automate it would be to use something like Simba to do it.

Of course, the best way is if you could automate it from the command line with a script or something.

Read full topic
